# INTRO

Continuing work with Valentina's PolyIC project after [creating cDNA on 20251019](../../2025/2025-10-19-Reverse-Transcription---C.gigas-PolyIC-Mechanical-Trials-RNA-for-Valentina-from-20251002/index.qmd) (Notebook entry), it was time to run the qPCRs.

This notebook describes how the qPCRs were run and links to the various output files. It also provides a brief overview of each primer set's amplification profiles. This notebook does _not_ have any analysis. This will be performed later.

# MATERIALS & METHODS

The following primer sets were run:

| SR ID | Primer Name          |
|-------|----------------------|
| 1827  | Cg_cGAS_F            |
| 1826  | Cg_cGAS_R            |
| 1383  | Cg_citratesynthase_F |
| 1384  | Cg_citratesynthase_R |
| 1510  | Cg_DNMT1_F           |
| 1511  | Cg_DNMT1_R           |

All samples were run in triplicate, on low-profile, white 96-well plates (USA Scientific) sealed with TemPlate TR Select Optical Film (USA Scientific) in a CFX Connect (Bio-Rad) or CFX96 (Bio-Rad) real-time thermalcycler. All reactions consisted of the following:

| Component                                          | Stock Concentration | Volume (uL) |
|----------------------------------------------------|---------------------|-------------|
| cDNA                                               | NA                  | 1           |
| SsoAdvanced Universal SYBR Green Supermix (BioRad) | 2x                  | 10          |
| P<sub>F</sub>                                      | 10uM                | 0.5         |
| P<sub>R</sub>                                      | 10uM                | 0.5         |
| H<sub>2</sub>O                                     | NA                  | 8           |
| TOTAL                                              |                     | 20          |

Master mixes were distributed across three plates for each primer set and included no template controls (NTCs).

For cycling parameters, plate layouts, etc. see the [RESULTS](#results) section below.
